dialogue.utterance: Hey, nothing much going on here. What did you do today?
Oh just hanging out. Its so hot out I just wanna stay inside, and clean my house.
I was cleaning my room, and found some pictures of my Uncle Dexter, remember him?
Hmmm the name sounds familiar but I can't picture him
What did he do again?
Well, do you remember you went camping with us and he made a BIG fire.
He works in construction he owns a company.
Oh yes! Now I remember
We always had so much fun with him
Hahahha. I knew that would help. I found an old picture of him starting a great fire.
I remember that night so well
You can see the face of another man in the back. Do you recall his name?
Like it was yesterday
Tim... I think?
HAhahhaha. It was great fun. We should do it again sometime. TIM....thats it. Your right.

dialogue.utterance: How was your weekend
Thats good to hear. My weekend was pretty fun. I did some baking.
How was yours?
Very nice! I love to bake! I made a peach cobbler for the fourth
Wow that sounds delicious! Cobbler is one of my favorite desserts.
Did you also do fireworks for the fourth?
I was just looking back at a silly photo my uncle sent me of a trip he took when we could still do that
No fireworks for us
We are shutdown
What trip was it?
Well I am happy to hear that you followed safety measures!
He went to Europe and took a pic of himself with a man painted like the tin man
Care to take a look?
Ha! That does sound really silly. I would love to see.
Crazy guys
Wow that is a huge lolipop.
Awesome picture!
Well it was really nice chatting with you and I hope that you have a great night!
It is right
You too! Good night.
Thank you!

dialogue.utterance: Hey, what's up?
It is stormy around here
It is over at my house. You?
It was raining heavily
Oh wow! It's not that bad here. How bad is it at your place?
It is already dark with heavy thunderstorms
Oh! I hope your property doesn't take any damage. Have you consulted the weather channel?
Yes
I'll keep an eye out over here if it gets too bad. Great rain for the plants though!
Anyway I am going to share a photo of my family before the storm
Okay
We were going on a trip using the bus
Ah, city transit?
Oh wow, the bus is super crowded!
Yes the local transit
Your sister looks so cute!
The bus was super crowded as it is the start of the weekend
She is single. I may set you up
She is my niece and her name is Elina
Makes sense! I'm glad your family made it home on the bus before the storm.
Haha, thanks but no thanks! Sorry, your niece looks just like your sister!

dialogue.utterance: Hi!
HI
How are you?
Doing well, how are you
I'm good! What have you been doing these past few days?
Staying inside and social distancing. Watching the office on netflix
I love the Office. I've been binge watching it with my boyfriend.
You?
That's awesome! It's my favorite show!
I've been watching a lot of TV but I wish I could go outside. My boyfriend and I have been going crazy from staying at home for too long
I miss going to beaches and traveling...
I miss beaches and traveling as well. They are both wonderful

Thats my boyfriend and I smiling.. Oh how much I miss the happy times.
Whoa! That does look like a nice beach! Where is it at?
You both look so happy

dialogue.utterance: Hey how are you?
Not too bad. How about you?
Pretty good just a little restless.
Oh really? Why?
I'm not sure. I guess just being stuck in the house all the time.
Yeah, that's been happening to a lot of people recently.
Yeah I'm just making as good a use of the time as I can.
Cleaning house and organizing.
I try to enjoy the quiet time before things start opening up!
Oh me too! I'm pretty tired of cleaning actually. haha
Yeah me too.
Cleaned the garage this week. No fun. :(
I'm even doing things I've never done like going through my books.
I did that a couple weeks ago. It took a long time!
I don't even remember some of them. It's like I'm getting new books.
I can't even make out what language these are in haha.
Haha. That's not a bad thing I guess. It's like free books!
Tell me can you?
Let me try!
Hmmm, maybe it's written in camel? :)

dialogue.utterance: Hey, great to hear from you!
Nice to chat! What's up with you?
Just got back from a trip with my dad, Brandon.
Fun! Where'd you guys go?
We went to Vegas. I am looking at my vacation pictures and there is one that has me laughing so hard.
Vegas! Did you win??
Nah, but it was fun anyway.
Bummer. But glad it was fun. What was so funny about your pic?
Our last day there we stopped at a cafe and saw the strangest thing.
Theere was a man dressed up as a plant, just walking around the tables.
That's totally bizarre.
You can see my dad in the picture just totally oblivious to it though. That is what makes it even funnier.
Ha! That's odd, lol!
People in Vegas are weird.
My dad is totally focused on his meal.
Must've been good food haha.
It was. But I never did learn why the guy was dressed up as a plant. It will be a mystery forever.
Indeed. But a good memory. :)
Good chatting with you, we will have to do this more often.
Definitely!
Take care.
You too.

dialogue.utterance: People seem to either love or hate Donald Trump. He is the 45th president and had been in office since Jan. 20, 2017. Do you like him?
dialogue.speaker: Kitzie

dialogue.utterance: I tried to give him the benefit of the doubt when he was elected. Hate is a strong word. I do not support a lot of the decisions he's made while in office, though. But maybe you can give me a balanced view. What do you know about him?
dialogue.speaker: Alfonza

dialogue.utterance: He grew up in Queens but then went to Pennsylvania to get an economics degree from Wharton, so he's at least well educated.
dialogue.speaker: Kitzie

dialogue.utterance: I see. That makes sense. Can you tell me anything specific to his election and/or presidency?
dialogue.speaker: Alfonza

dialogue.utterance: I don't know much in depth about his presidency just know some about him. He entered the race as Republican and actually defeated 16 other opponents in the primaries.
dialogue.speaker: Kitzie

dialogue.utterance: I had no idea he defeated 16 people in the primaries. I guess that sort of is impressive, and is a testament to how much people wanted him in office. What is something more unique about him that you know?
dialogue.speaker: Alfonza

dialogue.utterance: I find this an interesting fact. He owned the Miss Universe and Miss USA beauty pagents from 1996 all the way to 2015.
dialogue.speaker: Kitzie

dialogue.utterance: Hah... probably a first for an elected president. You're right, that is interesting. I actually want to hear something else along those lines, as I'm sure there are many unique things about him that make him stand out as a president, good or bad, because of his colorful history.
dialogue.speaker: Alfonza

dialogue.utterance: Most people know that he was the host on The Apprentice but most people are unaware that he the the producer, as well.
dialogue.speaker: Kitzie

dialogue.utterance: I guess I could have imagined that the producer. That makes sense. What's your go-to fact about Donald Trump that you like to share with people?
dialogue.speaker: Alfonza

dialogue.utterance: hi, how are you?
I'm doing well, thank you!
That's great to hear!
How are you?
I am also doing well. Keeping busy
You know my grandpa used to be a captain on a boat? I finally got to go on board last week!
Oh yeah? How was it? I've never been on a boat
It was quite neat, and his crew is like family to him.
Do you want to be a boat captain as well?
No, but I enjoyed seeing him! We then went to have a drink at the pub close to where he was docked. I took plenty of pictures and met some interesting people.
What did you order to drink? I enjoy whiskey on the rocks myself.
What drink did you order?
That's my favorite as well. I saw someone that you might know.
Who did you see?
Take a look at the photo I got!
Oh hey! It's my old nanny. What a small world

dialogue.utterance: Hello friend, how are you?
I'm good! You'll never guess, but I went to see Resident Evil with my uncle Carmelo!
That's awesome, how was the movie!
It was great, and we go to play Resident Evil 6 too
It was part of a comics convention
That's amazing. I didn't know your uncle liked Resident Evil or comics conventions!
Or rather a gaming convention
Were there a lot of people there?
Yeah, he's a really cool guy
Oh yeah, there were a ton of people around taking photos and stuff
Cool, you'll have to invite me the next time you go
We took some photos too
Wow, that looks awesome. The escalators look a little scary. lol
They were fine, the elevators got pretty crowded
Well, I hope to go the next time. Let me know.
I'll definitely let you know!

Been so long since we last talked that I'd hate to have the conversation cut short already

Oh wow - beautiful!

dialogue.utterance: Hi there, how are you?
I'm good and you?
Well, thanks! We just had a party for my granddaughter Aislinn. It's her birthday.
Aweh how nice, how old did she turn?
Eighteen. So scary to think that she's an adult!
Wow congrats!!
I remember when I was 18
Me too! It's crazy to see her and realize it's been that long since I was young.
I completely agree. So how was the party?
It was fun, I think. She had a bunch of her friends come as well as family. I have this photo of her putting a silly hat on her boyfriend. Want to see?
Absolutely!
Sure, hang on a sec.
That's so fun! They look so happy

dialogue.utterance: Going anywhere this summer?
Had plans to go to Miami but those got canceled. How about yourself?
Sorry to hear that but I too was thinking Florida
Perhaps to one of the theme parks
I have always wanted to go to Disney World
I've been to Disneyland in California
A friend of mine went to Universal in Asia

anything special about it?

Here let me show you a photo I received.
That's your friend and her daughter? It seems like the mom is having more fun haha

hmmm it looks very tech type maybe futuristic
but I couldn't guess the exact theme
Thanks ok. Well, perhaps we can talk later. You ok?
I normally like the fairyland type of themes since the colors are a lot brighter and calm
yes,talk to you soon

dialogue.utterance: Are you doing great?
I am. I'm hanging out with my friend and my friend's daughter Catalina, and their new puppy!
Hello?
Great!
No social distancing in place?
I'm staying 6 feet away from them. They're close to each other since they live together.
Hmmm
I'd love to hang out too!
Maybe next time!! I'll have her bring the puppy - she's the cutest little girl!
Puppy? You love them?
I do. I love puppies. And this one is so little and cute. She has the tiniest little ears.
I took a picture to show you. Catalina is the one in the jeans holding the puppy.
Great little cutie!
Can I have it?

dialogue.utterance: Hi. How are you doing?
hanging in there. how about you?
I'm doing okay - been a long day
Hope the weather has been nice were you are
been a long week for me. so glad for the weekend.
Time to just relax!
NOT weather. spent all day today outside. so sweaty
It's been quite hot here too lately
I was at a zombie festival with my son, Asher, all day today. You ever been to one?
zombie festival - no. But it sounds really cool
Did you dress up?
yeah, but would have been better in the fall. it was over 100 degrees today.
WOW! That would have been really hot
I didn't dress up. my son got "zombied" by people there. they did zombie makeup on him.
I bet that was really fun for him.
I took a pic of when they were doing it, but then my phone died. so I don't have an after photo. :(
Wow - that looks like it would be cool
it did look cool afterwards. you'll just have to trust me
I better go. I need to jump in the pool and cool off.
I trust you. Glad you guys had a nice time

dialogue.utterance: Hello! How are you?
I'm good! But where are you? I thought you were coming to Donna's going away party?
I got food poisoning, unfortunately. I'm bummed to miss it!
Oh no! That sucks....well, it's a good thing you're not here then because we're at a restaurant lol
Oh wow! How is it?
It's actually really good! It's that fancy Italian joint where you can create your own pizzas.
That's amazing! I wish I could be there. What did you get?
Well, so far we've ordered a goat cheese pizza and then one with lots of basil!
Oh, and wine of course ;)
Donna is having a great time!
Sounds like a great time. Glad everyone is having fun!
Donna and the rest of the gals at work say hi!
They say feel better, too :)
Tell them I say hi back! Enjoy!

dialogue.utterance: As a bigger guy I'm really trying to live on a restricted diet with a combination with physical exercise, to reduce body weight. Do you have any tips?
dialogue.speaker: Yukio

dialogue.utterance: Funny as a bigger girl I just started doing this.  Each morning I have a diet protein shake with a bananna
dialogue.speaker: Cezar

dialogue.utterance: I wish I was like my father who has to follow a special diet to gain and keep on weight.
dialogue.speaker: Yukio

dialogue.utterance: Tell me about it.  My middle daughter is the same way. She is like her father, definitely not me. But I lost weight with my morning shake plus 1 meal a deal before.
dialogue.speaker: Cezar

dialogue.utterance: I tried the shakes but I'm still hungry after. In general, the most effective diet is any which reduces calorie's in so now I'm a calorie counter.
dialogue.speaker: Yukio

dialogue.utterance: Try another kind. There are so many. Add a banana, chia seed and flax seed. The seeds are tasteless and they bulk up the water to fill you up. I drink water and diet green tea all day too.
dialogue.speaker: Cezar

dialogue.utterance: Thanks for the tip. I did stop drinking any soft drink and now only drink water and Green tea. I love it and it's roots dating back to China.
dialogue.speaker: Yukio

dialogue.utterance: Yes it's awesome stuff!  The real stuff I get at the asian market but during the day I drink the Lipton diet one.
dialogue.speaker: Cezar

dialogue.utterance: I can't make my self drink Lipton, I'm from Scotland and it's British I can't support them. I do like other cold teas like Turkey Hill and Wawa Green Tea. They are local to my area.
dialogue.speaker: Yukio

dialogue.utterance: Turkey Hill I like too. I wasn't aware Lipton was an American company, interesting...
dialogue.speaker: Cezar

always working!
ttyl!

dialogue.utterance: So what have you been doing lately?
Working from home mostly.
You?
Yeah, me too. I try to get out when I can, went up to the Lake the other day, it was very peaceful.
That sounds really nice.
It was, got a chance to be out in nature.
I love nature i wish i could get out more.
I make time, if it's a beautiful day then I try and take advantage of it anyway I can.
hear any good music lately?
Yes im listening to music right now.
What music do you likie.
Many kinds, but lately into instrumental stuff.
I listen to todays hits radio on spotify so all types of music.
right now pop music.
You like accostic guitar?
Yes i do.
Recently I came across a group of girls sitting around and having a impromptu concert
Do you have a picture of it, i would like to see.
It was great, didn't care what else was going on, just out and enjoying the day in the sunshine.
As a matter of fact I do, I'll just go share it with you, hang on.
It reminded me of the 60's and sit ins, are you familiar with that?
I wish i was young again i would definitely take up playing guitar.

dialogue.utterance: Hello
hey, whered you go last night?
I had to leave to catch up on some work.
really? i saw your post from the okcorral...
really doesnt look like you were getting much work done...
I know, I was hungry and needed something to eat first.
were you sharing a bud light meal with your friend?
Yes.
hahahah looks like you were having fun who was the band?
I'm not sure, I think it was a local band that was playing.
big crowd too, must have been great.
Yeah, it was alright.
yeah, did you meet up with the rest of the guys?
they said they were headed down there too.
Only for a bit and then I had to leave.
i know right? been so busy lately, cant seem to catch up,, hope they get some new temps in soon.
I hope so also. We could use some help.
yes, they are planning that new project soon. hope it comes with a bonus.
What new project? I haven't heard about it.
yeah out of detroit. they are gonna send 4 people to start scouting. then they will support from here. supposed to need 10 more staff here for support.
are you interested? i can put in a good word for you.
Sounds good. I might be. I'm starting to look at current job offerings.
ok, will do, i will let you know what they think, i think you would be a good fit for this. i will get back with you later...
Okay, talk to you soon.
have a great weekend

dialogue.utterance: Hi. How are you?
Hi, I'm doing good
How about you?
Good to hear. Doing fine on my end. I had a great time at an event that included some of my students.
Awesome, so what was the event?
We went to a museum then afterwards they wanted to go to a bar for some drinks.
Must be fun
Did you find anything interesting at the museum?
It was. Yes, it was fun. The bar afterwards was fun as well. Want to see a picture of some of my students at the bar?
Sure
Great. This is Karla in the center. John is next to her. It's a master's level class so we are all able to legally drink!
It was a trendy bar, as you can see.
They wanted to go after the museum. I like more laid back bars.
yes, it looks nice. I like the atmosphere.
It was fun. Well, gotta run. Thanks mate. See ya around.
hahaha

dialogue.utterance: hi how are you this evening?
Doing fine. Working at the local homeless shelter.
That's great. Do you enjoy helping other's in need?
I do! I love the thrill of seeing people get something out of the work I do.
That's wonderful. I'd bet it is very rewarding. I feel the same when I do something nice for someone.

It is great. But it's not without its problems. Our head chef despises his job. We work by donations, and he resents having to cook with the ingredients we give him. We'd love to do more to help him thrive, but it's been a struggle.
That's unfortunate. I feel like there is always someone like that in every job
Maybe so. He's a good man. He just struggles a lot. He finds it hard to be content.
Somewhat understandable. I had a boss like that at my last job.
Yeah.
I've got a pic of him here.
It is frustrating though. You'd love to see them happy but they struggle so much
I know, right?
Anyhow, I've got to head off. I'm needed! Thanks for taking the time to talk.
Have a great night!
You too

dialogue.utterance: Hey how's it going>
Hi, I'm good. How are you?
I've been good. Just got back from vacation with my boyfriend Jasper
Fun! Where did you go?
We've been unpacking and trying to unwind after spending a whole bunch of time with family. We went to South Caroline
*Carolina
Jasper and his cousin started a huge water fight with all the younger cousins
That sounds fun! I've always wanted to go there, but haven't been yet.
It was my first time there too. It was a lot of fun to meet his family and get to spend time at the beach
Did you like his family?
Yes, they were very nice. I'm hoping this will be the next step in our relationship
During the water fight, Jasper's cousin forgot he had his bluetooth headphone on, and I think it got ruined
Sounds promising to me.
Oh no! Poor guy.
Yeah, he didn't even realize it until Jasper told him, which happened to be when I snapped this picture

dialogue.utterance: What should I get uncle teddy?
dialogue.speaker: Caroline

dialogue.utterance: You could get him a tie.
dialogue.speaker: Roberto

dialogue.utterance: Are you kidding? That's the stupidest gift one can buy. I don't want to get a tie.
dialogue.speaker: Caroline

dialogue.utterance: Why not?
dialogue.speaker: Roberto

dialogue.utterance: Everybody gets men ties for christmas. It's too boring. Everybody buys either ties or sweaters. I want a more unique gift.
dialogue.speaker: Caroline

dialogue.utterance: Well, you can buy him a pet iguana then.
dialogue.speaker: Roberto

dialogue.utterance: That's a cool idea. At least it would be a surprise. But I'm afraid he wouldn't take care of it.
dialogue.speaker: Caroline

dialogue.utterance: He would think you were crazy, caroline.
dialogue.speaker: Roberto

dialogue.utterance: Yes. An iguana is too strange for a gift, and a tie is too normal. So I have to find something halfway between.
dialogue.speaker: Caroline

dialogue.utterance: How much do you want to spend?
dialogue.speaker: Roberto

dialogue.utterance: Well, he was very good to me. He helped me edit my essay for the scholarship contest. So I want to spend at least 75 dollars.
dialogue.speaker: Caroline

dialogue.utterance: Alright, I have an idea. You know he carries that conservative-looking briefcase every day.
dialogue.speaker: Roberto

dialogue.utterance: Yes.
dialogue.speaker: Caroline

dialogue.utterance: Well, he isn't a lawyer, so I don't think he needs to have a briefcase like that.
dialogue.speaker: Roberto

dialogue.utterance: What should he have then?
dialogue.speaker: Caroline

dialogue.utterance: I have just recently retired.  I worked my whole life as a school teacher in the same school.  I am looking for ideas of things to do now in my retirement years.
dialogue.speaker: Abbagail

dialogue.utterance: Nice to meet you. I'm sure it will be great to spend some time with your family. A families support is all we need at times.
dialogue.speaker: Eladio

dialogue.utterance: Lovely to meet you too and very true.  I have my children and grand children living close by and there is nothing better than spending time with them.  I need to find more hobbies for myself though too.  I have started a walking group and a painting class.  I am thoroughly enjoying my retirement.  Have you long to wait before you can relax and retire?
dialogue.speaker: Abbagail

dialogue.utterance: Yes, I have a long way before I can retire. As a matter of fact, many people are choosing to put off retirement and are selecting to be put into preretirement. That sounds great that you are doing hobbies though!
dialogue.speaker: Eladio

dialogue.utterance: What does preretirement mean?
dialogue.speaker: Abbagail

dialogue.utterance: Preretirement is when people choose to retire only when they are eligible for certain benefits. Although some people do have to retire early due to their physical conditions such as not being able to work.
dialogue.speaker: Eladio

dialogue.utterance: I understand now.  I worked for 44 years and although I loved my job and the children, I felt it was time to say goodbye and enjoy the years I have left.  It means I have so much time for family and of course for me.  What field do you work in?
dialogue.speaker: Abbagail

dialogue.utterance: That's wonderful. I work in the medical field. I hope to one day be able do a semi-retire where I could reduce my work hours to spend more time with my family. I do have a long ways to go before I get to that point in my life.
dialogue.speaker: Eladio

dialogue.utterance: I commend people in the medical field.  It is such a tough job but where would we all be with you.  It can be very long unsocial hours though so semi retiring would be a lovely way of doing it.  Away in the future for you of course!
dialogue.speaker: Abbagail

dialogue.utterance: Yes most definitely. It is very common in most countries for people to retire. It started as early as the 19th and 20th centuries! So although it may seem recent for us, it  has been happening for a while now.
dialogue.speaker: Eladio

dialogue.utterance: Thats fascinating.  We think in this day and age that we invented everything but alas we clearly did not!! lovely chatting with you.
dialogue.speaker: Abbagail

Just trying to chill being in home in this disease era
What about you?
Same. These times are so crazy. I miss my students!
Thats nice of you. you are a great teacher. I miss my teacher
A teacher who cares her student is always great.
Ahw, thanks! I actually go to see one of my students (Kenley) the other day. She lives in my neighborhood.
Oh I know that kid. She happens to be one of my friends' daughter
Oh no way?! It's a small world.
Kenley is cute and charming kid
What did you do at Kenley's place?
So cute! I planted some flowers the other day and she loved them.
Just wov. She looks so innocent and beautiful like flowers
She was walking by my place with her parents!
Her parents are really blessed to have this super cute kid
I'm going to miss having her as a student but hopefully i'll still see her around the neighborhood!
Yes. Have a good time. Convey my hi when you meet her
Will do! Talk to you later :)
ok bye :)

why
why

parents will be parents

hope you had fun at least

i did
it was nice chatting with you too
try to rest ok

bye

dialogue.utterance: How are you doing today?
Fantastic, and you?
Great. I'm having lunch at my family's beachside condo and we're playing games.
That sounds like a lot of fun!
It is. We haven't had a vacation in a long time and it has been a difficult year of loss.
I understand. Its been a difficult time for a lot of people. You are not alone :)
We're trying to teach the young ones that we can enjoy life again. Right now we're playing Charades and my brother Fabian is drawing.
That's lovely.
This is a photo of Fabian drawing an alien from outer space. I think it looks like a boat. But he's a boat builder, so duh!
LOL very cool! Fabian is taller than I remember!
Yes. Hope you have a great day!
You too! Thanks!

dialogue.utterance: Hey there, how are you?
Good Morning! I'm doing great. Just came back from a long walk. How are you?
Nice! Props to you for that. I'm good thanks, just listening to music and drinking coffee.
Looking at some pictures
Pictures you just took or some old ones?
They are some older ones, found a picture of a baby eating some cake. Trying to figure out who it is. Maybe you'll know.
Got cake all over 'em.
I could try. I have a quick question. I have a very old picture that is framed from my Mom. It is from when she was young. Do you know who would repair a rip in the picture?
Hmm. Unfortunately no. I know we had a photo repaired/remastered of my great grandmother. I would check into it.
That would be great! Is the picture with the baby and cake in a home you remember?
Hmm, good question.
Not sure. Could be. Gonna have to think on that one.
Not too much to see, just a window and some olive paint.
Kind of looks like a mutual friends old room now that you mention it.
Lemme get it uploaded and we'll see what you think.
That sometimes helps me. Hey, didn't your Aunt Helen's house have a lot of olive paint colors? We used to make fun of it and say she was in camouflage!
See what you think.
Oh yeah! Maybeit's there.
Have a good day.

dialogue.utterance: Hello how are you this morning!
I'm well and excited to chat with you! What's new today?
Just hanging out with my friend Bonnie. She's such an amazing woman!
Oh, fun! Tell me more about Bonnie.
She's got a kid that she's trying really hard to expose to more culture...and I think she's doing a great job!
I have a picture here somewhere of her from yesterday...showing how adorable they are together
I think it's important, too, to learn about culture. I'd love to know more about that photo.
I wish I could figure out how to share it and show you this woman and child immersed in culture!
I think you'd really like it!
Maybe you could describe what they were experiencing when the photo was taken.
There I figured it out!
Isn't that great? Well I appreciate talking to you. I hope you have an amazing day!
That is a really beautiful image. Thank you for sharing!
You're welcome. Enjoy your day.
You, too! Good bye.

dialogue.utterance: What did you do today?
I went to a bike safety school for my young son
Did you do a lot today?
What did you do today?
I cleaned my house. It sounds like you had more fun.
IT does! I need to do the same
I needed to mop. I had layers and layers of dirt.
Did your son learn anything new?
Yes they checked his bike out for safety. They also taught him how to wear his bicycle helmet correctly.
Is he good about wearing a helmet? My kids always hated wearing them.
Yes he's pretty good about it. I would hate wearing one too if I rode.
Yes, but it keeps you safe.
Wow. I love the blue helmet.
I do too it's his favorite color
Thanks for talking to me.

dialogue.utterance: How are you?
Doing better. Finally got a chance to get out of the house for the holidays
Is that so
Where did you go?
Was so scared of the virus. Finally went to a holiday party with social distancing in our local community park
Good for you
people were enjoying the pool and other activities 6 feet apart
but some of us were sitting by the side...not very courageous to jump in the people
Right
Who's that?
See my niece sitting on the side
Ah
That is Alisha, my niece
she was so tempted to jump in to the water, but didn't
Who knows if the virus survives in pool water
Hope this virus goes away soon so that we all can get a normal life
Me too
Hey, I'm getting a call. Will catch up later
Alright

dialogue.utterance: Hi
Hi! How are you?
I am good, how are you?
Pretty good, I just got off the phone after talking to my uncle.
Cool, what did you guys talk about if that's not too personal.
Not at all! He's a model, and he was talking to me about his latest shoot.
He was modeling some vintage suits!
That's awesome, what brand of suits was he modeling?
You know, I'm not actually sure! XD I'm pretty bad at keeping up with all of that kind of stuff. My uncle, Israel, is much more up to date than me!
That's fine, I was just curious. Your uncle has a unique name, what country is he from?
Haha, he's from the US. Not Israel! Here's a photo from the shoot. I could probably get you the name of the brand if you like the clothes!
Yeah that's a great suit, if you could get the name for me that'd be great!
Right? Sometimes it makes me wish girls wore suits more often!
I just texted him. Apparently it's from Dolce & Gabbana's new line called American Pastoral.
Nice talking to you! Have a good weekend!

dialogue.speaker: Bayleigh

dialogue.utterance: Well, as for albert, he should go to an office supply store. There's a very good one called office depot. They have everything he will need. And their prices are good too. It's very convey
dialogue.speaker: Lawrence

dialogue.utterance: Can I write that down?
dialogue.speaker: Bayleigh

dialogue.utterance: Sure, it's spelled office and then d - e - p - o - t. It's in the yellow pages.
dialogue.speaker: Lawrence

dialogue.utterance: Thanks.
dialogue.speaker: Bayleigh

dialogue.utterance: And as for the kitchen things, do you want very high quality?
dialogue.speaker: Lawrence

dialogue.utterance: What do you mean?
dialogue.speaker: Bayleigh

dialogue.utterance: I mean, do you want the best quality, or do you want good prices?
dialogue.speaker: Lawrence

dialogue.utterance: Probably good prices. You know we will only be in america for about a year.
dialogue.speaker: Bayleigh

dialogue.utterance: Then I suggest you go to k-mart or wal-mart.
dialogue.speaker: Lawrence

dialogue.utterance: What are those stores?
dialogue.speaker: Bayleigh

dialogue.utterance: Hey. How are you today?
I'm doing good. And you?
Doing good. Just got a chance to let you know about that party I was telling you about the other day. My Dad's 60th birthday party.
How was it?
He made so many hot-dogs, and sausages it was insane. We stopped by the baked goods store to buy fresh buns. It was great.
My Dad Alfred likes to cook on the grill. It is one of his favorite things to do, so we got him a new grill. He used it to make the hot dogs and sausages.
Really? I bet they looked delicious too!
Wish I had some.
They did look good, while he was cooking them. They tasted very good as well on a brand new grill.
wow! They do look good.
I'm sorry I couldn't make it to the party. I would love to come over and try his hot dogs some time.
Yeah, they did taste very good as well. Just wanted to let you see how it turned out.
I wish you could have. For sure. Ill talk to you later.

Oh

dialogue.utterance: Just attended a meeting. I am really tired.
I am sorry to hear that. I hope you got some good information from your meeting.
Yeah. My parents are really interested in taking measures to protect the environment and they are trying to make me do the same thing.
That is an interesting topic. Is it something you want to do?
Kind of. Us humans are destroying forests and cutting down trees to build infrastructures and buildings and this action is really costing the lives of millions of innocent animals.
This drives me to protect the environment
I agree. We definitely need to be more conscious of things like that. I think that people who advocate for the environment are so valuable to our society.
The one thing I did not like about the meeting was that there were a lot of people and most of them were men
I think women should also be part of such meetings
Another thing is people were drinking soda and eating food in paper plates in a meeting where we are talking about conserving the environment
Absolutely! They too have input and ideas
You can see in the picture
That is contradicting to eat from styrofoam! Maybe they were talking about a different environmental factor? I see a railroad sign. It's hard with large gatherings to control that.

dialogue.utterance: Hi there!
Hi! What are you up to today?
Just relaxing on a Sunday night before it's back to work Monday, you know!
The weekends just fly by!
I know what you mean. I just got back from my niece's birthday party. It was really nice.
Oh, fun! Are you two very close?
Yes. And I'm close to my sister. My niece turned 4. She's a big fan of the Disney princesses, so that was the theme of the party.
How sweet! Did you get her a present?
I did, and I bought the cake too. She went crazy for it. I think I have a picture of it. Do you want to see it?
Would love to!
Great! Give me just a minute to find it.
What do you think?
OMG, it's beautiful! I'm sure she was thrilled!
Thanks. She was.

dialogue.utterance: I am so impressed with my son and how well he did in school this year.
dialogue.speaker: Ephraim

dialogue.utterance: I understand, since I am a tutor/teacher at times. Does he have any special accomodations?
dialogue.speaker: Treasa

dialogue.utterance: No he's a regular student. He does wear glasses but then so do I so it's inherited. What subjects do you teach?
dialogue.speaker: Ephraim

dialogue.utterance: I tutor on nutrition, healthy food choices. I am doing a nutrition certification and there are support groups where people need advice!
dialogue.speaker: Treasa

dialogue.utterance: Oh lots of people are interested in nutrition. My daughter is a massage therapist and people ask about nutrition often
dialogue.speaker: Ephraim

dialogue.utterance: Your daughter will literally save the world one day. It seems there is a strong gap between nutrition and medicine these days.
dialogue.speaker: Treasa

dialogue.utterance: You're in the right field. It's so odd how people don't understand the importance of what they eat. Do you have any hobbies?
dialogue.speaker: Ephraim

dialogue.utterance: Yes, nutrition can be very tricky. My hobbies are music and computer programming, but the latter can be very frustating. How about you?
dialogue.speaker: Treasa

dialogue.utterance: My hobby is growing fruit trees. I got too good though, and had 80 mango's this year. Too many, lol
dialogue.speaker: Ephraim

dialogue.utterance: That is pretty neat. Magoes are one of my favorites fruits, but I have to cut back on the sugar.
dialogue.speaker: Treasa

dialogue.utterance: Yes, they are very sweet. There is a jamaican man that discovered my tree and so next year I may just hang bags of them for him to grab
dialogue.speaker: Ephraim

dialogue.utterance: Very kind of you to share the mangos. We often try to donate food as often as we can to the shelter here.
dialogue.speaker: Treasa

dialogue.utterance: Do you like the whole dating process? I find it tiring, but also fun.
dialogue.speaker: Randell

dialogue.utterance: I guess today technology with Tinder and other online apps dating should have been easier but it has only gotten more tedious. Thankfully I don't have to stress with that myself buy my friends do.
dialogue.speaker: Jodie

dialogue.utterance: Tinder has made it easier to get laid, but not necessarily easier to find real connection. I think that's the worst thing about modern dating.
dialogue.speaker: Randell

dialogue.utterance: Unfortunately true as most persons are not looking for meaningful relationships but just hookups. Can you believe its jus tbeen 6 years since Tinder cam eout in 2012! It seems it has been around much longer
dialogue.speaker: Jodie

dialogue.utterance: It does! I wish we could find a way to emphasize true connection. Everything seems to be getting more superficial and trivial as time goes on.
dialogue.speaker: Randell

dialogue.utterance: I guess my courtship may seem archaic to many today. My husband and I had chaperone and he even asked my parents for permissions to marry. Getting to know each other in fun settings
dialogue.speaker: Jodie

dialogue.utterance: That sounds really interesting and much different than what people go through today. I suppose there would be pros and cons to that type of relationship.
dialogue.speaker: Randell

dialogue.utterance: No relationship is perfect but a courtship based on respecting boundaries while getting to know each other before marriage have resulted in a strong relationship for the past 18 years.
dialogue.speaker: Jodie

dialogue.utterance: Absolutely. It seems like people are staying together for shorter amounts of time, having a lot of casual hookups, and not taking their bonds with people seriously.
dialogue.speaker: Randell

dialogue.utterance: More traditional values and courting practices can still work today. It is a refreshing change to a persone who had a long line of casual hookups. It doesn;t mean the male has to do all the courting but just be respectful of yourself and others.
dialogue.speaker: Jodie

Jodie contrasts this with her own experience, sharing a photo (Photo 1) of herself and her husband on their wedding day, illustrating a more traditional courtship involving chaperones and parental consent.  This approach, she explains, has led to a strong 18-year marriage.  The conversation concludes with a reflection on the differences between modern dating trends and more traditional values, highlighting the potential benefits of respectful, intentional relationships.

dialogue.utterance: hello
hello, how are you?
great, you?
I'm great.
I just came back from vacation.
Oh, nice. Where have you been?
Always hard to get home and back to normal life!
I went to a zoo with my family.
Oh that's great I bet that was a fun time.
What were your favorite animals to see?
I did. Thanks.
Giraffes and sheeps.
I think sheep are so cute.
I do too.
You want to know somiething cool I saw as we left the zoo?
The last time I saw giraffes at a zoo they smelled really bad, lol!
Yeah what was it?!
A hige boulder. It was bigger than my little nephew, lol.
Want to see?
Absolutely
That's awesome! Looks like he's having fun climbing it

dialogue.utterance: Did you have a good weekend?
Yes, my weekend was good. Spent time with the family.
Oh!! That is wonderful! What did you guys do?
I got to see some family too! We were outside tho and I got a little sunburned.
We just hung around the house. We started our Christmas decorating. We hung up our stockings
Wow!! How many stockings did you have to hang?
We hung up 4 large ones and a couple of small ones on the fire place.
What did you guys do outside?
Oh there is nothing like a good fireplace. I bet it looks beautiful!
It does look beautiful. I took a picture of my daughter in her Christmassy red shirt just as we were getting started. She had a good time.
We sat around and talked. Hadn't seen some of them for a while so there was lots to catch up on. Had a few cool beverages as well.
Awww she's so cute! She looks like a very nice girl. You must be very proud.Looks like dad is adjusting the stockings!!
Your weekend sounds relaxing.
Yes, he was very helpful.
It was! I wish I had a picture, but it sounds like we both got some good family time in.
Yes. Well, I have to run. Talk to you soon.

dialogue.utterance: Hello! how are you doing today?
I'm doing great! How are you today?
I am doing well thank you. What are you up to?
Not much. I hung out with my sister Madelynn today.
Oh cool! yeah how is Madelynn doing?
She's great! Our grandma came over and was showing us how to cook some dishes with the limes from the trees in our backyard.
Nice. So you get limes from your own backyard huh? That is neat. What did you guys make?
Yeah we even got a picture of them together. We made some tacos with lime juice on top.
Cool! Your grandma's recipe huh? Will you share some photos?
Yeah she's great! And definitely! Here you go
Cool!

Not much, just came back from visiting with my brother.
how is your brother?
He's doing good. We had a nice time visiting.
I got to meet his roommates.
how many room mates does he have?
what are they like?
He's got two. They like to go out, and you know me, I'm a homebody type.
well at least you got out to see your brother! is his place cool?
We didn't stay much at his place. It's a nice apartment. Him and his roommates kept me busy.
They liked to go out every night. It was exhausting!
what did they have you doing????
where did you go out to?
Here's one of the nights. My brother is giving me a weird look. LOL
funny!

dialogue.utterance: I have three dogs, two are pets and one is a working dog but he is a big sweetie too!
dialogue.speaker: Jaiari

dialogue.utterance: I'm with you. Dogs over cats, any day. There's a reason dogs were one of the first species to be domesticated, and they've essentially been hand-picked over the decades, as they've been selectively bred over millennia for various behaviors, physical attributes, etc.
dialogue.speaker: Tylen

dialogue.utterance: Yes indeed my two females are mostly inside dogs and guard my home, they do go out in the day but they are protective and territorial
dialogue.speaker: Jaiari

dialogue.utterance: They've been around us, as humans, for so long that they've kind of evolved to suit us as much as themselves, and have become attuned to our behaviors. They can eat starch-rich diets that other canid species couldn't, for example.
dialogue.speaker: Tylen

dialogue.utterance: Yes my girls seem to be in tune with me. My male is a working livestock guardian dog and keeps livestock safe from predators
dialogue.speaker: Jaiari

dialogue.utterance: Livestock guardian dogs are so impressive. Even just the sight of them keeps predators at bay. It's interesting how instinctual a lot of dog behavior is, how intuitive they can be. Your dog sees the herd and knows as its core that it must protect it.
dialogue.speaker: Tylen

dialogue.utterance: Yes he seems to know its his job I can't even call him up if he sense danger near the herd he will not leave them, super intelligent!
dialogue.speaker: Jaiari

dialogue.utterance: It's that intelligence that leads them to fill so many roles in society... hunting, herding, pulling loads, protecting, assisting police/military, and not to mention companionship. They've been great in social work too, to provide therapeutic assistance to individuals with disabilities.
dialogue.speaker: Tylen

dialogue.utterance: They are so tuned in to their owners too, that is why people say they are mans best friend. Cats are just self centered and weird lol
dialogue.speaker: Jaiari

dialogue.utterance: How useful and admirable they are as pets today makes you want to study their past... They're slightly related to the gray wolf, which is considered their "sister taxa," but we don't really know the first direct ancestor of the dog these days, and likely means that they're extinct.
dialogue.speaker: Tylen

dialogue.utterance: Hello
How are you
Hey there! I'm good, how are you?
I'm pretty good thanks
How was your day been
It's been good! Just missing people since I've been social distancing. Looking at some old photos
Really missing my family
I am sorry to hear that. I have social distancing for months now as well.
What photos are you looking at
It's hard huh? I'm feeling pretty alone. There's one picture of a funny situation with my niece
It really is.
Oh I would love to see that!
We got lost in the mountains (in our car) and the construction workers were so mad at us for driving in their area!
She was trying to make light of the situation
I'm excited to see them again.
Lol thanks for sharing that is hilarious
I hope seeing them helps
I'm glad to share it with someone, so lonely haha
Me too. I hope you see your family soon too!
Again, I am sorry to hear it

dialogue.utterance: I know it sounds strange, especially these days, but I've been hitchhiking across America. I like the older world feel it gives me, traveling in a way that trusts strangers for a ride in their automobile. Makes me feel like I'm time traveling back when there wasn't as much technology, for some reason.
dialogue.speaker: Javion

dialogue.utterance: Isn't hitchhiking unsafe nowadays?
dialogue.speaker: Laurent

dialogue.utterance: It can be.. all you're doing is standing by the road and using hand signals to flag down drivers in order to ask for a free ride. So, you never know who you'll interact with. But for some people, that mode of transportation is all that's available to them.
dialogue.speaker: Javion

dialogue.utterance: That is true. I'm sure there has to be a better way though. I mean you have to deal with cars and people but also the weather.
dialogue.speaker: Laurent

dialogue.utterance: You may have a point.. but because of its rich history.. how common it's been throughout time, and how prevalent it is across the world and how often it's practiced, very few places have laws in place to restrict or prevent it. They see it as unpreventable, in a way. So, it will always be around.
dialogue.speaker: Javion

dialogue.utterance: I'm sure those who hitchhike have a good reason too. Hopefully there aren't many cases where they are harmed for doing so.
dialogue.speaker: Laurent

dialogue.utterance: I'm with you. On a lighter note, it's fascinating to see the different styles of hitchhiking signage throughout culture. Like, obviously you could just have a written sign, right? But with hand gestures, in North America/UK/a lot of Europe, they just extend the arm toward the road and stick the thumb of the outstretched hand upward. But in some AFrican countries, the hand is held still and they just face their palm up. Australia has it where they just point their index finger at the road. Fascinating.
dialogue.speaker: Javion

dialogue.utterance: Oh yeah that is really different. I guess I thought it was always unsafe to try and pick up a hitchhiker and I mean the media doesn't help any with their movies.
dialogue.speaker: Laurent

dialogue.utterance: How are you?
Good - it's raining outside right now so I'm just relaxing inside the house. How about you?
Literally the exact same, haha
My niece just sent me some photos of her earlier in the year
Oh - that's nice. I always love seeing photos of family. Mine live far away now so I don't see them often.
Yeah. I miss her
She loves these fashion stuff – dresses, footwear and all
Yeah I miss mine as well - that's nice also. Is she in to any specific brands?
Not really. She likes to handmade pieces herself.
Oh that's neat - has she made you anything?
Yes. She made these dresses out of magazine straps with her friends
Can you believe it? the whole body covered with just magazine paper
Awesome - those are really pretty. Pretty impressive she has that skillset
I can imagine it, definitely really creative - oh wow - very talented
Thank you!!

dialogue.utterance: Hi! Doing anything fun?
Nope. What have you been doing?
My grandson is visiting for the weekend. I'll use him as an excuse to watch animated movies on Netflix!
Sounds like so much fun. I wish I had a grandson
They're great, plus you get to give them back after a few days and let someone elae worry about them!
I don't think I've ever met him before
That's a very good point
No, I think you saw Brad's kids, but not Tammy's.
Really? I guess I'm losing my memory
Haha! I'll remember for you. I'm the brain, you're the legs!
There he is!
Aww they're so cute
I just wanna pinch his cheeks
Thank you! He's got very pinchable cheeks, you're right

dialogue.utterance: I have hair and it mean i am one of the  1–2% of the human population that have it
dialogue.speaker: Pharaoh

dialogue.utterance: Oh really? Is there a huge population of invisible people without hair?
dialogue.speaker: Kaaliyah

dialogue.utterance: Well, it appears most commonly in people with two copies of a recessive allele on chromosome 16 which produces an altered version of the MC1R protein. Do you understand my biology terms.
dialogue.speaker: Pharaoh

dialogue.utterance: Of course. However, I take issue with your statistics. If only 1-2% of people have hair, there must be many more people with the dominant allele for hairlessness, yet everyone I see has hair.
dialogue.speaker: Kaaliyah

dialogue.utterance: For a deeper explanation, Red Hair is characterized by high levels of the reddish pigment pheomelanin and relatively low levels of the dark pigment eumelanin.
dialogue.speaker: Pharaoh

dialogue.utterance: Ah, so I believe there was perhaps a typo in your first sentence. You stated, "I have hair and it mean i am one of the 1-2% of the human population that have it). I believe what you meant was that you are a member of the 1-2% of humans who have red hair, caused by the homozygous recessive gene for red hair found on chromosome 16, thus altering your MC1R protein and giving you a red-haired phenotype.
dialogue.speaker: Kaaliyah

dialogue.utterance: Yes, you are right. DO you know anything abou t the Hair color. It is is the pigmentation of hair follicles due to two types of melanin
dialogue.speaker: Pharaoh

dialogue.utterance: Yes, it's similar to skin color in that it's caused by the amount of melanin produced. I believe, like skin, differing amounts of melanin can be produced depending on levels of UV radiation exposure
dialogue.speaker: Kaaliyah

dialogue.utterance: How are things?
Great! How are you?
I just returned from vacationing in England and something exciting happened.
I am doing good. OH! What happened?
I was able to see Princess Ann! The Queen's daughter. It was unbelievable. I even got a close up picture of her!
No, way! That's awsome. Was there a lot of people?
Tons! It was a huge crowd, but I was able to get within a close distance of her.
I have never seen a royal before.
I was able to get a photo, would you like me to share it?
Yeah, that would be great!
Look at those sunglasses, so regal!
Isn't that amazing? So close up. She was so gracious too about people taking pictures and wanting to talk with her.

dialogue.utterance: Hi, how are you?
I'm doing great, how was your day?
Great! We are having a wonderful time on our vacation, the buildings are so old and interesting.
Oh wow, I'm glad you got to take a vacation, I had to cancel mine because of covid 19
I'm so sorry to hear that. Right now I'm sitting in a starbucks drinking coffee and eating a splendid bagel with all sorts of good things inside.
Oh that sounds so relaxing and fun! How is the weather there?
The weather is a little cloudy but still nice. Yesterday, we ate a hamburger at McDonalds, so I guess fast food can be found all over the world.
I hear McDonald's is the most common fast food that you can find world wide.
Did they have anything interesting on the menu that we don't have here?
I can believe it, I'
I've seen quite a few on my travels.
oh that bagel looks really good!
The menus are about the same.
It was very good and now it's completely just a memory a good memory since I ate it all.
I love sitting here and watching the world go by out the window.
All the buildings here are creamy white, which gives them a more ancient look.

dialogue.utterance: Good evening, how are you doing?
i am doing great. how are you?
I'm hanging in there - tired from the day.
Me too. It has been a long day
Yeah ... what's up?
I took my granddaughter Blaire to a cornfield today
To a cornfield - nice to get outside. What did you see?
It was a tractor ride and a cornfield maze, really interesting
Oh, wow - I like tractors. What kind of tractor?
We saw the countryside, and the tractor ride was like fun
Cool - what was so fun about the tractor ride?
It was large green one with like a cattle cage for people to ride in
Ha, sounds like a John Deere. Nice. Where did you ride?
it was just a nice day, and the person narrated the trip
That's great - did the narrator tell a story?
Just around their little farm.
Yes, about the crops and the other farms
Did you see animals?
Oh, great, there's the picture of ya'll!
Looks like a great adventure!
We saw a few of their cattle, but not a whole lot else
it really was
Blue skies, too! Glad you enjoyed it!
i'll chat with you tomorrow, thanks for reaching out

dialogue.utterance: Hey there!
Hello. How are you?
I'm good, what are you up to?
I was just going to tell you about the carnival we went to. It was so much fun.
Have you been to any lately?
Nooo, I havent! It's been raining up here, so no chance to :(
But that means you'll have to tell me all about it!
Oh so sorry:( We went and this guy was there. We were able to watch him paint in live action. Really cool!
Oh that's amazing
Who did you go with?
Just some friends. He painted this really cool looking clown. It looked so realistic.
Oh man, did you take a picture?
I did. Would you like to see it?
Of course!
You get it?
Wow, that is trippy

Good morning, hope your day is well so far
Just got up a bit ago here..it is early morning yet.
I had a great time with my niece yesterday
Sounds nice..what did you do?
She was bored so I took her to an art class with some kids her same age
That was very nice!
The art teacher was really nice and did a lot of hands on with the kids in the class
I like art and studied art in school..what did they work on?
They had some clay objects and used colored pencils to add color to the background they used
Oh, that sounds like that would have been fun.
It was a lot of fun, they are really talented with using different things for art
That is a good talent to have.
I will send you a photo so you can see
Is this a pic from the class yesterday?
Yes, I am so proud of them for the work they did
I would be too! Take care..I gotta get going!
I told my niece she could be the next Picasso
Bye Bye

dialogue.utterance: Hey how're you doing?
Good. Just got back from a wine tasting with my brother Brock.
Wow that sounds like a lot of fun!
It was! It was good to get out of the house. We met up with some friends from his work.
Yeah I bet that was nice. Hopefully Brock didn't get drunk like last time.
No, luckily the wine glass was small this time! He didn't let it go to his head.
That's good. That was embarrassing getting thrown out. Did you buy any wine?
I did, I imagine it'll be nice to enjoy a glass this evening. The evening ended on a serious note though, as we found out someone from Brock's company was let go.
Oh that's terrible. It seems to be happening to everyone. Hopefully things get back to normal soon.
I hope so as well. I only managed to take one photo of the event and everyone looks really sad in it.
Yeah he looks very contemplative. I'm sure things will work out.
Yeah, it'll all be okay, I'm sure. I'm gonna go enjoy another glass of wine!

dialogue.utterance: Hey! How are you doing?
Good! how are you?
I am doing well. I am currently enjoying a state fair.
State fairs are the best. There's so much to do and see!
Agreed. There isn't too many people out at this fair now. I don't mind that.
Oh, definitely. Crowds make me a little anxious. What's been your favorite part so far?
Definitely the food. I just bought some cupcakes from a vendor and I am waiting in line to get more.
You know a food is good when you have to wait in line for it!
Yes! When I first bought the cupcakes, I thought I had enough for the rest of the day. I ended up finishing them in a few minuets with my friend Leia.
Yummmm. Were they fancy or straightforward?
Here is a picture so you can see some of them. They had a variety.
Oh nice! Yeah, that looks like a pretty good setup.
Is Leia in line in front of you?
I loved the vanilla ones that they made. You have to try them sometimes!
Yes. In the striped shirt. We should all go out the next time you are around.

dialogue.utterance: Hey hows it going?
Hi, do you have any vacation plans?
Not at the moment, why whats up?
I'm about to travel to Europe with my father.
His name is Samir.
OH, tell your dad hi for me. Europe sounds fun. What part are you going to see?
We are going to Slovenia. He is the ambassador there.
Wow. Is Slovenia nice this time of year?
Yes it is very beautiful in the summer.
Well, I hope your father wont have to much work to do when he goes, hope he has time to visit and relax.
My father will be very busy and will be holding a press conference with people from other countries as you can see in this picture.
I would guess yeah. Being an ambassador is a lot of work.
Agreed. The job is very demanding at times.
Well make sure you have some fun while you are there at least!

dialogue.utterance: Hi friend!
How's it going?
Hi
Going well
How are you?
What are you up to? I'm just looking through some of my photos.
I'm just relaxing after a stressful day at work.
Finding anything good?
Well, found an odd one. The one I'm looking at is of my boyfriend, Callum.
Why is it odd?
It's of him participating in some sort of demonstration when he was in college.
I don't know what it's about, and don't recall him mentioning anything.
From before you were together? Does it show you anything about what the demonstration was about?
Sorry - realized you said you don't know.
Have you asked him about it?
He is holding up a sign that says Canada is not unquestione....and then I cannot read the rest!
Maybe you can figure it out
Let me show you the picture
Sure, I'm happy to take a look
No, I have not asked him but i will ask him when he comes back from work today.
Hmm, yeah I can't make it out either
Keep me posted, definitely interested to hear what he has to say about it!
Oh well. I will ask him later.
Will do, thanks!

dialogue.utterance: Hello, how are you dear friend?
Hi, I am doing well. I just had the best meal at a cafe.
Really? That’s sounds fantastic! Tell me all about it.
I had breakfast at a bar. Sounds silly, I know. Atmosphere was dark, with one small candle on the table.
That’s sounds lovely, quiet and intimate. Such a beautiful ambiance! What did you eat?
The dishes were basic and white. I ordered a latte with extra foam, presentation was not the best but it tasted good. I ordered what I can only really describe as a meat and cheese crepe- unfolded.
The silly I was not given any fork to eat with. Only a knife and spoon. f
Wow, that sounds enticing! Wish that I could have been there to enjoy such a lovely breakfast.
That’s silly, but I guess you could have just requested a fork.
That is true. It was pretty busy at the bar. Although I could not see anyone in my line of view, the waitress left a menu and extra coasters on the table
Sounds like you’ve had a memorable experience! Stunning image!

Such a delight!

dialogue.utterance: Nice today, but going to be hot tomorrow!
We are expecting rain, which will be great for the garden.
Do you like to garden?
I do like to, but we haven't even planted ours yet!
Do you have a favorite plant?
Green beans all the way
I was going to work on it today, but got a surprise call from a friend for a lunch date
Those are the best - the green beans and the surprise calls
We were eating at the restaurant, and then this weird bike rider guy gave us $10 to take a picture with him.
That's strange. What did you do
I took the money and paid for my lunch with it :)
That's great.
Any idea what will happen with the photo
Yeah, it was cool. Hey, I gotta run, need to get going to bed.
Nice talking with you
Have a good one

dialogue.utterance: hello
Hi how are you?
good. ive been keeping busy by baking.
Nice, I have also. I baked a pie from scratch the other day
i was debating on baking sweet or savory things.
I have a sweet tooth and had so many loquat fruits in my garden to use.
Then I made cupcakes. What have you baked so far?
loquat..how exotic. i decided on making sweets. made gingerbread houses. Christmas in june!
Oh that is nice and festive. I think I'm going to make a apple pie next now that I know how to make the crust
Or maybe a loquat meringe pie
once you've got crust you can make any pie. I even made two versions of my ginger bread house.
Those are beautiful!
not sure how im going to eat all these
I'll mail you one!
lol. my little one would love that
ok.. got to go. have a good one!
you too!

dialogue.utterance: Hello my dear friend. How are you doing today?
Hi there!
I'm good how are you?
I am good. Do you have any plans for the weekend?
It looks like the weather will be lovely.
Just relaxing. I wanted to tell you about a great meetup I had at my local library the other day.
That sounds neat! I love libraries. Please, tell me more about it.
It was a welcome-back party for our community after being able to open our doors to the public again.
There was a great buffet table with lots of amazing food.
I'll show you a pic.
That sounds awesome.
I should have been there! Food looks delicious!
Please let me know next time you have a such a meeting.
Will do, have a great one!

dialogue.utterance: so whats you up to?
I was recently at an event with a bunch of people. We were huddled close together. Before the virus pandemic, though.
waoh! you got me all fired up, thought it was doing the pandemic
No way. I'm not worried or nervous about pandemic, but still wouldn't risk that.
Anyway, want to know more about the event?
absolutely, we just gat to do what we can do to get ourselves safe
sure
so how did the event went?

Well, it was a casual event and most people were wearing athletic jackets. I wore an athletic jacket I've never worn before. a couple of people had helmets on, but we didn't do any riding or anything dangerous.
waoh! thats cool
looks like fun

dialogue.utterance: Hi. How are you today?
Good morning
Good and yourself
I'm good. I got to spend the morning with my nephew Malachi.
We spent the morning at his school.
That's cool. How old is Malachi?
Pretty young. He's almost 4.
His mom dressed him in a pretty cute red outfit with a gray sweater.
That's adorable. Was his name given to him based on the biblical character?
Yes, I believe so.
I'm not sure if it is spelled exactly the same, but when I see the name Malachi it instantly makes me think of such
Pretty cool name nonetheless. I like it.
Yep, I'm pretty sure you're right, but I'll have to ask his parents to know for certain.
Here's a picture of him today!
Oh my gosh he looks so adorable! Looks like he doesn't mind the outfit either. He shouldn't. It looks awesome
Yeah, he's a cutey. Have a great rest of your day!

good

nice chatting with you
Bye!
see you

what did you eat today

I mean send the picture but Maybe someone she knows is sick. You should ask hr
her*

No, if you feel like something is wrong should ask her whats up

She looks fine, and you can't be a mind reader so communication is best.

dialogue.utterance: What's the life expectancy in your country?
dialogue.speaker: Kavi

dialogue.utterance: I'm not sure, but probably about 75 years. How about in your country?
dialogue.speaker: Karizma

dialogue.utterance: About 70, I think. This newspaper article talks about the problems of an aging population. It's a problem that will soon affect most of the world.
dialogue.speaker: Kavi

dialogue.utterance: I heard that the government might need to increase the retirement age, because otherwise there will not be enough workers to support the young and the elderly.
dialogue.speaker: Karizma

dialogue.utterance: Perhaps we need to have more babies! Tina gave birth to a baby boy yesterday.
dialogue.speaker: Kavi

dialogue.utterance: Did she? That's great. However, if we have too many children, that will have a bad effect on the enviroment.
dialogue.speaker: Karizma

dialogue.utterance: How's your son these days?
dialogue.speaker: Kavi

dialogue.utterance: Oh, he's fine. Kids seem to grow up very quickly nowadays.
dialogue.speaker: Karizma

dialogue.utterance: He'll be a teenager before you know it! Teenagers are often rebellious! When do you mine it is a good age to have a child?
dialogue.speaker: Kavi

dialogue.utterance: I had mine when I was 24. That's a little young. I'd suggest you wait until you are in your late twenties., or even in your early thirties if you have a good career.
dialogue.speaker: Karizma

dialogue.utterance: Yes, I think you're right. I'm thinking about having a child, but not just yet.
dialogue.speaker: Kavi

dialogue.utterance: Is there a big generation gap between parents and their children in you country?
dialogue.speaker: Karizma

dialogue.utterance: Yes, there is. Teenagers do not want to live traditional lives. They want to go out, have fun, and explore the world. They want to develop their own view of life. Parents usually try to discourage them, but they don't often succeed.
dialogue.speaker: Kavi

dialogue.utterance: Parents usually give their children more freedom in my country. Sometimes they give them too much freedom.
dialogue.speaker: Karizma

dialogue.utterance: Hi how are you
I'm doing well. What have you been up to?
Well we just had a big get together for my mom since we missed Mother’s Day together
Oh that's nice. I'm sure it was lovely.
This quarantine has kept us at a distance so we decided to celebrate finally she deserved it
It's nice that you were able to celebrate together.
Everyone had a blast. My siblings and I made some desserts and we were able to catch up. How bout you
Have you been able to catch up since quarantine
I've been well. We recently got a dog. A little Corgi. Her name is Luna.
That’s sweet! Adding a new addition to your family.
Yes. She is a handful but so sweet.
Here is my family’s celebration
That's a really nice picture. You all look to be doing well.
It was really nice catching up. Talk soon.

Now he has a dog?
Amazing!
He still sends me random snippets. One a day of his life.

Here's one.

very cute dog

Yeah, the dog defniitely is cut.

Yeah, It's good to talk with you , pal
Good talking with you, too!
Catch you later.
Have a good day,!

dialogue.utterance: Hello
Hi, I hope you are well.
Same with you,. How did you like that class last night?
I did not attend a class last night. What are you learning?
We talk about the novel by Stephen King "Pet Semetary". My sister Maya was the spokesperson.
That is a scary novel. Stephen King only writes horror type novels. How is Maya doing?
She got everyone intrigued by her pertrayals, she's really good at story telling. There were about 30 of us.
DId you learn anything about the novel that you did't know previously?
Not really, everyone was pretty knowledgeable about the story already. We actually were able to analyze it pretty deeply. Lot's of emotion with this one.
Are you an avid Stephen King reader?
Yeah, I am. I took a photo of the group, for memory sake. I tend to do that.
Looks like a diverse group. That should have benefited the conversation.

dialogue.utterance: How are you?
I am doing great, just enjoying a party, you?
Damn that sounds fun! I miss going to parties I am always busy lol.
I am doing well by the way.
Oh wow, same always busy but this time I get to have fun for a bit.
Good for you, how's the party now?
Very fun, we got this bartender that's currently mixing some type of cocktail right in front of me.
Sounds like you're really having fun, can you describe the cocktail?
Sure!
It's this white concoction if you will, that's all I can say, with some Bacardi on it, here have a peek.
He looks to be really working hard on those cocktails haha, thanks for sharing, looks like a party to remember!
Sure is, thanks for the chat, have a good day!
Same to you have a good one.

dialogue.utterance: Hey, there! You know Ariel is due back from her trip soon. Have you heard when her flight is?
I didn't know she was on her way back. So I have no idea when her flight it.
When's the last time you heard from her or got a text?
I last got a text from her like two weeks ago.
Yea, that's about the same for me.
Did you text her about her flight?
I'll write to her and see what she can tell me. The last time she sent me pictures, she said she would be firming up the departure details.
She looks like she had a great time by the huge smile she has on her face in all of the pictures.
Yeah, I saw some of her pics online. Well, text me when you get her flight information.
Which pic did you see? She sent me one with a guy and they're both wearing coats. Must have been cold. Did she tell you his name?
I saw this pic. I don't know the guy's name.

dialogue.utterance: Hey, what's going on?
Nothing much, how was your day?
Pretty good, thanks. I just got back from a girls' weekened with my friends April and Jane.
what did you girls do on the trip?
We went into the city to sightsee. Mostly silly tourist stuff. But April is such a nut. We took the funniest pics in our hotel room.
Oh man that sounds like fun. I wish I could go out on a trip with some friends but I've been stuck working overtime.
Did you buy anything nice?
Well that stinks! More money though! We did, a bunch of new clothes. Actually one of the pics is of April in a dress she bought. She was trying out these weird angles.
Oh that sounds adventorous, did she post any of them?
Yeah, hang on. She has one that makes her head look huge, lol.
did she post any?
Funny, right?
yeah its a very odd angle
Fun memories for sure. I hope you have a good night! I'll talk to you later.
same, good night

dialogue.utterance: Do you know much about the Bible?
dialogue.speaker: Tanishka

dialogue.utterance: Sort of like the song Dont Know Much by Cynthia Weil and Tom Snow, I don't know much about any religion, I'm open to learn though.
dialogue.speaker: Yadiel

dialogue.utterance: I think people use the term 'religion' to justify so much these days - to me the Bible is the Word of God, pure and simple.

dialogue.utterance: I think that's because some 'Christians' may not really be - not for me to judge, but there is a lot of hypocrisy.

dialogue.utterance: Hi there!
dialogue.speaker: Bexleigh

dialogue.utterance: Hi,  I hope you're doing well today.  I just got back from horseback riding.  Do you ride?
dialogue.speaker: Junior

dialogue.utterance: I actually do not ride. But many of my students are into horseback riding.
dialogue.speaker: Bexleigh

dialogue.utterance: It is so much fun.  I love to ride my horse on the ranch, he is such a good working horse.
dialogue.speaker: Junior

dialogue.utterance: That is awesome. What are some qualities or traits that I should look for in a good horse?
dialogue.speaker: Bexleigh

dialogue.utterance: You will want to look for a horse that has a calm disposition if you want to use it for riding.  You should really look into seeing if you have access to guided rides in a nearby park.
dialogue.speaker: Junior

dialogue.utterance: I am very interested. I tend to think of horseback riding as a relatively expensive endeavor. Are guided rides expensive?
dialogue.speaker: Bexleigh

dialogue.utterance: It is not too expensive at all.  The really expensive part is owning one.  Another option would be a horseback riding simulator.  They provide the opportunity to gain the skills needed without the danger of riding on trails for a beginner.  And they are really cheap!
dialogue.speaker: Junior

dialogue.utterance: That is insane. I had no idea that horseback riding VR was a thing. But I guess it makes sense. My stepsister used to barrel race at rodeos. Do you ever do anything like that?
dialogue.speaker: Bexleigh

dialogue.utterance: I don't have a whole lot of time outside of my duties on the ranch, but several of my friends do the rodeo.  They do pretty well because they gain the skills on the ranch.
dialogue.speaker: Junior

dialogue.utterance: Have you always lived on a ranch?
dialogue.speaker: Bexleigh

hello.

indeed

talk to you later!

dialogue.utterance: Hello friend! How are you?
Hey! Good how are things with you?
Really good! What's new in life?
Oh not too much just being cooped up in the house! I teach school and they cancelled school for the rest of the year so that's been a bummer.
What's new with you?
I hear you...being cooped up can be rough at times...I'm educating my daughter, so I can imagine how you feel!
Yeah! I was looking through some pictures of my students from earlier this year and one really made me laugh.
Kids can do that! They are always good for a laugh!
Ha ha yeah they are! This student Madalynn is sure a card. Would you like to see the picture of her?
I'd love to! Especially if it's a funny picture!
I sure think it is. Here you go!
I love this picture! Which one is Madalynn?

What do you think?
Oh, dear. I see what you mean.
Hee!

dialogue.utterance: Aunt cindy, do you shop online often?
dialogue.speaker: Ronika

dialogue.utterance: Yes. It's very convenient and the price is even lower.
dialogue.speaker: Marleen

dialogue.utterance: Last week, I tried to buy some books online, but I didn't know how to pay for them?
dialogue.speaker: Ronika

dialogue.utterance: You should open an account at the online bank first. After that, you can buy anything online.
dialogue.speaker: Marleen

dialogue.utterance: Are there many things online?
dialogue.speaker: Ronika

dialogue.utterance: Sure. You can find everything all over the world. Let's check it out online!
dialogue.speaker: Marleen

dialogue.utterance: Oh, what's this? Second-hand cellphone store?
dialogue.speaker: Ronika

dialogue.utterance: Yeah, this one is very famous with a good credit among on-line customers. It's like an open free market. If you want to change your cellphone for a new one, you can sell the old one here.
dialogue.speaker: Marleen

dialogue.utterance: Really? How to do that?
dialogue.speaker: Ronika

dialogue.utterance: Take some pictures of the thing you want to sell, then upload it onto line with a brief description about it and leave your connecting number. Then your stuff will be sold by auction.
dialogue.speaker: Marleen

dialogue.utterance: That's amazing. I'd love to try it later. Oh, an on-line virtual supermarket?
dialogue.speaker: Ronika

dialogue.utterance: Let's click to check it out.
dialogue.speaker: Marleen

dialogue.utterance: Oh, I got it. It simulates the real supermarket, which makes it feel so real. Mom will love it. She loves shopping in supermarkets.
dialogue.speaker: Ronika

dialogue.utterance: No doubt about it. Shopping online will get more and more popular. It's a real revolution about people's consuming habits.
dialogue.speaker: Marleen

dialogue.utterance: Are there any disadvantages about it?
dialogue.speaker: Ronika

dialogue.utterance: It takes some time for the stuff you buy online to arrive. But I think this problem will be solved soon.
dialogue.speaker: Marleen

dialogue.utterance: Your first cake? lol
whoa, hard to remember but I think it was banana pudding.
I hate bananas! You know that! I can't even drink a banana daquiri!
How long did it take you to make that??
I am not crazy about them either to be honest
Well, good thing you put chocolate on it then!
Oh, I didn't make it, I thought you meant the first cake I ever ate>
Well, it looks good!
I usually just bake regular yellow cake.
I want to share the pic, but can't!
Why?
That's always safe and you can switch it up easily enough.
Yea I guees you're right.
I like lemon cakes...pound.
Really? I don't like lemon cake.
what kinds do you like? I'll remember for your birthday that's coming up soon!
Chocolate cake with cherry filling
Bleah! I LOVE chocolate but hate cherries - more for you! ;D
Cool.
Are we gonna take another cooking class together soon?
Sure sounds good.
I want to send you a pic from our last event but it won't let me share it?
You sure look demented, though!
Oh well thanks.
It's hilarious!!
You look like you're gonna attack that cake!
There it was...all the way at the bottom! NOT under the pic! My bad!
Yea my appetite can get a little carried away.

dialogue.utterance: Went to a party the other night. My sister hit it off with a guy and now they're dating!
Really?
What’s his name?
I don't know yet lol. I probably should have asked her. But she was so excited that I didn't get it out of her.
Haha. Sounds just like her!
Is he cute?
Yeah.
He is. He was a bit awkward, but he warmed up as the party went on
She's able to see things in people most people can't.
What else did you find out about him?
He's a farmer. I laughed when I heard that, but at least I know he works hard
Wow! Well he must be in great shape then
He's in pretty decent shape, but you can't tell in the picture.
I'll share it with ya!
Let me see!
They look so cute
They are. She's just such a bubbly person.

dialogue.utterance: hey friend
Hi, how are you?
Im doing fine. It is 5:30 am here so many people are starting to wake up
Same here, i'm actually getting ready to walk the dog!
It is important to start your day right so I try to eat breakfast whenever possible. Do you?
Admittedly, I do not. I usually have 3 cups of coffee for breakfast.
I used to have a coffee maker, I used to drink the whole pitcher on nights where i had to study
That's a lot of coffee, not that I don't drink a lot. What do you like to eat for breakfast?
Pancakes and eggs. I usually go without syrup and simply add the sugar to the pancakes. I feel like it is very easy to overdo it with maple syrup
Yea, that makes sense. I don't normally eat breakfast, but eggs over easy along with bacon or sausage is always good.
Have you ever eaten at a diner?
Yes, it's been a few years since they're usually greasy, but I have.
Haha yes they really are grimy. Here is a picture, it reminds me of what you would expect to see at a diner
So true!

dialogue.utterance: Hello! How are you?
Hey! I'm great. We are really enjoying our vacation!
Oh nice! Where did you go?
I feel like you told me but I can't remember offhand.
We went to Colorado. We are eating at a super cute restaurant for breakfast!

We are eating raspberry filled busicuits while eating outdoors and enjoying the crisp clean air.
That sounds amazing. I bet it's beautiful (and delicious).
It is! They have other flavors besides raspberry. The waitress said they have blueberry and strawberry also.
They all sound tasty to me.
I can't wait to try blueberry tomorrow!
Oh, those look good!
Here is the raspberry busicuit and placesetting!
